bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Born 24 March 1907 in Ada, Ohio, William L. Groth attended the University of Richmond from 1928 until 1932. Mr. Groth joined the Virginia State Police in March of 1934 and was promoted to Sergeant in 1938. He made Lieutenant in 1941 and Captain in 1942. In 1949, Mr. Groth was made Deputy Administrator of the Governor's Highway Safety Committ in 1949. Under his administration, Virginia received national awards for public safety education and organization of public transport for safety.

In 1955, Mr. Groth became the Director of Public Safety for the City of Richmond. Under his administration, the City consolidated the Bureau of Weights and Measures with the Division of Air Pollution Control and Boiler Inspection, lengthened and strengthened the police and fire recruit training, the construction of a new lockup at 6th and Marshall Streets, and a new administrative office for the 1st Police Division. He also implemented the use of police dogs and decentralized ambulance service for the city.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: The collection is composed published materials about Richmond from the late 1960s and early 1970s.
